body: > In brief > 🚀 This is the 1st beta version of Nos Gestes Climat, released in June 2020. ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Refuge_et_Pic_de_l'Étendard_(Savoie).JPG/400px-Refuge_and_Pic_of_l'Étendard_(Savoie).JPG) It is essentially a rework of the 2.6 model of the MicMac tool from Avenir Climatique, which was a spreadsheet file to download MicMac Web was not updated anymore, it was necessary to launch a new version of the interface, more modern, interactive, easy to make evolve and making total transparency on the calculations This repository contains the complete calculation model of Nos Gestes Climat, in the form of YAML publicodes files. The tool is in *beta* version: it is usable and already informative, but we have already identified many unsatisfactory points - the total is not the expected 11.2 tons - the numerical part is not complete, the footprint is underestimated - the only question for the diet is very disappointing - etc. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/89622912-0e9ab200-d894-11ea-9226-c4af37549cd7.png)
name: Étendard

body: glacier du Tour](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/50/Glacier_du_Tour_2021.jpg/270px-Glacier_du_Tour_2021.jpg) *The Glacier du Tour is located in the Chamonix valley, a valley accessible thanks to a superb mountain TER* ## Unpack your wardrobe Finally, we no longer ask you the question of *expenditure* on textiles each year, which was too sensitive to the quality of the purchases. Instead of counting 50kg CO2e for a t-shirt bought for 100€, we count the t-shirt's footprint. In return, it is up to you to catalog what you buy in general each year (or on average each year). A not so simple exercise... but rather interesting, no? ![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-57-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130571129-d0be75f2-989a-4f84-858d-0c8ce803e561.png) ## Subcategories visualization As you go through the questions in the simulation, view the footprint of the subcategories at a glance. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-48-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130569828-bee5d46a-0709-4e8a-ab6b-f94f54bbdf0d.png) ## Help notifications to understand the questions ![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-49-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130569970-663eb9ac-4647-4943-b4de-befb12bcb7e2.png) ## Back button We had removed this button because it was leading to bugs, questions were skipping and definitely falling into the void. After many requests, it is back and normally, free of bugs! ![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-51-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130570246-0bebdfc3-4fae-40c8-9011-6999713fdcf9.png) ## For those who heat with oil 🛢️ We have quietly changed the main input from kWh to liters There is of course always the option to enter the price, we estimate the consumption in liters at the quarterly rates published by the ministry. ## New personas. We did not communicate much on this functionality, but nosgestesclimat is equipped with a page `Personas`, which makes it possible to put itself in the skin of unspecified individuals to see their result of simulation. It is here, and we added some: nosgestesclimat.fr/personas > This page, improved, could become very important in the future: the personas could be designed to be representative of the French. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-54-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130570763-0101210c-3f08-49af-b376-572b649ad5d4.png) ## Various improvements We always listen carefully to your feedback! ### Input aids we have improved the input help for the plane for those who do not take it every year ([details here]( https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/commit/e3d74925b8ff31d6cf40531e6a07a1f97c9f1237)), and accommodation to accommodate less traditional lifestyles (camping car, truck, barge, details here. ### End screen We added the decimal in the final score of the test on the end screen ![ngc-fin-décimale](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130571538-ff8753ce-78c6-4d64-a63c-9128c015545e.gif)
name: Le Tour

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2b/Guadeloupe_from_ISS.jpg/640px-Guadeloupe_from_ISS.jpg?uselang=fr) > In brief > The first regional version to go beyond metropolitan France > a contributing internationalization platform > - more and more improvements of the model: default values for heating, air conditioning, biogas ## NGC international 🗺️ We launch internationalization and regionalization with a first new territory: Guadeloupe! This essential work that we had put aside for the moment was motivated by the initiative of Samuel Charvet student at the University of the West Indies in Point-à-Pitre

The customization of the electric mix factor, the localized suggestions for the airplane and the addition of the inter-island ferry are the main features of the Guadeloupe version, which will obviously evolve. This is only a first brick, our objective being to create a community of contributors first in France, then in Europe and in the world ## Adding air conditioning ❄️ Differentiating the model for Guadeloupe allowed us to realize the importance of air conditioning, and the relative importance of heating (for hot water) in this tropical region where no month is significantly colder than another Initially reserved for Guadeloupe, we have extended this air conditioning model to metropolitan France (in fact, the standard model at this stage because of its history) given the extent of air conditioning equipment in 2020: 25% of households would have it Its footprint is twofold: its electricity consumption (particularly carbon intensive in Guadeloupe) *and* its greenhouse gas leakage, which is significant (several hundred kg of CO2e per air conditioner per year) even in a France with a decarbonized electricity mix. The subject is complex (as it often is), so this model is only a first iteration to be refined ## Biogas 🔥🌱 It's a question asked many times: what about "green gas", also called biogas and more precisely biomethane? We investigatedthe footprint of biogas and validated the possibility of adding it in our calculation, it's done > Be careful, it is absolutely not a perfect solution, which should not replace the more perennial reduction of its gas consumption via electrification, sobriety and energy efficiency. ## Heating: average values 🌡️ A work on the average values of heating simulation has been done by carefully analyzing the statistics of the French housing stock. ## Tech ⚙️ As you may know, the particularity of ourgestesclimat is to be a form generated from an open calculation model. This is what makes it particularly robust to evolutions, because we don't painstakingly order questions by hand, and we don't recode entanglements like "if the user said he lives in an apartment, then don't ask him about the lawnmower": everything is handled for us The management of "mosaic" questions (the "heating" checkboxes or the choice of lunch and dinner menus) has been improved, and now resides directly in the model, alongside the other questions! What's the point? This allows contributors who don't want to bother with Javascript (and other coder considerations) to modify the questions in a very easy to access language
name: Guadeloupe

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Absolute_MtBlanc_01.jpg/400px-Absolute_MtBlanc_01.jpg)

> In short: Power, average footprint and some bugs

For this 2nd version of Nos Gestes Climat, we listened to the already numerous feedbacks and made these main changes.

## Food item

We introduce the choice of the type of breakfast 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/91868807-6ea72d00-ec75-11ea-81bb-982cac0ea55a.png)

As well as a new diet selector, much less rigid than a single diet.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/91868962-9c8c7180-ec75-11ea-86fc-2f12f26baf35.png)

## More representative default values

The simulator, by default, now indicates 11.7 tons, a figure closer to the average footprint of a French person (we were previously at 10) 

## Removal of the "finance" item

As explained in #24 , assigning a footprint to the money we have in the bank was a double counting. We have removed it.

## 🐛 shared car bug

In short, we were significantly overestimating the footprint of the shared car rental.

We now attribute a share of the vehicle's construction to each person who rents a car to get around. We were making the mistake of attributing *all* of the construction to him

body: ![périades](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116311567-ac7c3700-a7ab-11eb-8f01-8d486e2706f3.jpeg) > In summary > - new questions and model for taking into account the age and materials of housing construction > Lots of new climate actions > a conference mode in preparation, already testable > bugs solved ## Age of housing Previously, a house built in 1901 had a yearly construction footprint, as much as a house built in 2019. Ouch. That's corrected - age of the house -> whether or not a footprint is taken into account, the houses > 50 years old are now at zero - declination house vs apartment - declination traditional construction (concrete I think) vs eco-built See https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/994 ## Lots of new gestures to take action :boxing_glove Which brings us to a good 20! ![Capture d’écran du 2021-04-27 17-51-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116272451-32cf5380-a781-11eb-8601-0e6ac7e83f9e.png) ![Capture d’écran du 2021-04-27 17-51-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116272430-2d720900-a781-11eb-9786-e09c5f5e8fcc.png) But also - switch to LEDs at home - go without the car for trips < 5km - give up the tumble dryer - replace my gas boiler by oil After a last salvo, we will move on to improving the UX of this "climate gestures" part. ## A "conference" mode in preparation On the PR number 222, you can follow the progress of a brand new simulation mode for our climate gestures : make the simulation with several people ! It will be useful for conferences, for workshops, but also to simply test with friends. To test it, it is here 🏹 🏹 ![Capture d’écran du 2021-04-27 17-59-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116273752-5515a100-a782-11eb-8483-c378c2c7406e.png) ## Bonus : obsolescence of computer equipment We have at heart to fight against the digital footprint by not neglecting the devices that have a lower definition than the current standard. Here is a small improvement that goes in this direction: https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues/995
name: Périades

body: glacier de las Néous](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Glacier_de_Las_Néous_8_août_1905.png/547px-Glacier_de_Las_Néous_8_août_1905.png) > In short: > - a tutorial is displayed before the test > - seasonal, local food > - we help you to fill your km by car > - many new content on the screen / actions > - many other improvements to the model and the site ## A tutorial before the test 🧑🏫 We've added a tutorial for those unfamiliar with the concept of climate footprints and personal consumption climate footprints. This is part of our strategy to reach out to audiences not yet aware of these topics. The Ministry of the Environment has a demo of it here ## Seasonal, local food 🌻 🚛 We developed climate footprint variation models from Agribalyse corresponding to seasonal and local diets ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/140048614-299fc659-6c87-441c-ab91-4b79e7c44b11.gif) These improvements are, to our knowledge, an unprecedented work! You will see that these "options" have little influence if your diet is not already strongly vegetarian ## New screen to help with mileage entry while driving ⌨️ 🛣️ You may have noticed that it is difficult to answer the question "How many miles do you drive each year?" all at once So have we: so we've designed a form to help with that entry help to enter car km - demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151338682-c79c82d3-4582-4981-98ab-401dc8c81206.gif) Big bonus: this form also avoids estimating a vehicle fill rate, which is usually a very risky task ## Improvements of the "action" course 🎯 - two new actions to switch to seasonal and local food - we improved the action to reduce housing temperature: we now ask for your current temperature - a new action to go vegan - we separated the actions into different ranges, from "more than a ton" to "less than 10kg", and finally to "unquantified actions" ## Gas price 🔥 You will surely have seen it: gas prices are exploding in France. Between +40% and +110% in a few months. So we have revised upwards our tool to help estimate kWh from €/month To do so, we have reimplemented the gas bill at the regulated rate, including the various taxes and subscriptions that modify this figure. ## New profile page A small button appears on the home page, it indicates that you already have data on nosgestesclimat.fr. As before, we have no data on our servers, everything is local on your browser ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852468-1e9d0cf1-a19e-4540-8c9a-2bf9beb0c6da.png) Above all, the profile page has a new look, it is now much easier to navigate through your answers ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852657-f06c1d34-fc05-4c4a-8d23-8304cacfc4ea.png) ## Ecodesign 🏋️ *Let's keep in mind that the footprint of the service and use of a website in France is very small and already in general naturally optimized by developers. The environmental impact of digital is mainly related to manufacturing (70% for example for a smartphone).* ### Small screens We continue to work to support small screens Here are the improvements on iPhone5 SE ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/144875622-2991b5a6-69c9-4c04-9422-48c727cc81af.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/144875673-c96e2098-22bb-4e71-b993-3c121fd008a6.png) To do this, we have optimized the footprint distribution graph, by integrating the texts in the bars. It has also been animated, which makes it much easier to understand the impact of choices in the input ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852263-5fb7fe31-e13e-4ce5-96a8-4794d19f5ce7.png) ### Site hosting We have asked our host (Netlify), if it would be possible for them to implement a server in France so that our users can see their site served from France, rather than from Germany currently ## Coming in 2022 See our roadmap for the calculation model here
name: Las Néous

body: glacier de Gébroulaz](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a4/Glacier_de_Gébroulaz2.jpg/640px-Glacier_de_Gébroulaz2.jpg) > In short : > - Arrival of the survey mode > - A new metric: oil > - Improvements in the calculation model : caravan, camping car, car fuel, digital ... > Improvements in the actions: buy an electric car, subsidy for the purchase of a bicycle > - New pedagogical resources ## Arrival of the survey mode! 💾 * **What is it? The "survey" mode in Nos Gestes Climat allows several people to take the test while saving the data in a permanent way (total carbon footprint and by category). This mode can be particularly interesting in the context of a workshop or an event, a facilitator guide is available to help you! ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171632300-dba6d437-a9bd-44b3-afc3-874c1e7307d6.png) * **Survey customization The arrival of this new mode is accompanied by an additional feature that allows you to add a few questions to collect additional information as an introduction to the test. For example, this can be useful to organize a survey at the scale of an organization while allowing to filter the results by type of respondent (status...), age, place of living (while taking care of course not to compromise the standards of RGPD). We have also worked on the security of the surveys to avoid the introduction of vulnerabilities in our database via this feature. You will find all the info in our documentation! * **The group mode view page is better filtered In the previous version, any user who logged in to the survey appeared in the view graph. Some people counted as 1 participant without even having taken the test (with a score corresponding to the default values) and the ghost visits distorted the results (especially the average value!). This is no longer the case in this version since the data displayed is filtered by excluding users who completed less than 10% of the test questions. In case the survey is customized (see above), an additional filter is applied to display only the participants who completed the context questions. ## A new metric: oil! 🛢 To better visualize the amount of oil we consume in our lives, we decided to add to Nos Gestes Climat the corresponding number of full tanks, in addition to the CO₂e. For the moment, this metric is reported only on direct emissions related to oil (travel, oil heating ...) The way to both highlight our dependence on these fossil fuels but also to better visualize the impact of actions we can put in place: the number of passages at the pump speaks more than the tons of CO₂e, so swipe on the end screen to see your oil impact! ## Calculation model improvements 🧮 * **Added caravan & motorhome** There are now more choices in Nos Gestes Climat to go on vacation! Caravans and motor homes have found their place. Please note that for caravans, the number of kilometers traveled is to be included in the kilometers traveled by car. More information on the methodology in issue #1317. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/160854704-aa5b1010-e8f9-43cb-966b-ba80e6a8f731.png) * **Change in passenger ratio With the arrival of the km input help in the last release, a question remained about the choice of the vehicle fill rate applied to attribute the depreciation to the different users of the car. The details are available in issue #1337 and in the note of the "passenger ratio" variable * **More fuel choices Diesel (B7 or B10), gasoline (E5 or E10) or E85 gasoline (biofuels), you can choose! Be careful, however, about the message sent to the user when he or she selects biofuels. The carbon impact is certainly lower, but the emission factor is particularly uncertain: the issues related to land use are not taken into account! A notification is therefore displayed to explain this issue! All the info and discussions are in the corresponding issue #1396! * **Improvement of the digital mosaic New objects have been added for the digital mosaic #1359 : - 🎵 bluetooth speaker - 🔊 voice speaker - ⌚️ connected watch - 🕹 living room console - 🎮 portable console * **New heating modes** Heat pump (#1360) can now be selected! Thoughts are underway to add heat networks as well. ## Improvements in actions 💪 * **A "Buy an electric car" action is making its appearance** Proposed in case you already own a car, this action allows users to realize the impact (positive or negative) of buying a new or used electric car according to the kilometers driven per year. * **Addition of mesaidesvelo.fr in the actions Add a link to mesaidesvelo.fr in the relevant actions. The tool is developed by @mquandalle, who is developer on mon-entreprise.fr, and mesaidesvelo.fr is already integrated on the official website https://www.1jeune1solution.gouv.fr/. ## A new way to contribute 👥 Contributing is made easier for non-devs contributors! Repositories have been configured to allow you to modify or add new features in real time via a development environment directly in your browser. We explain everything in the Gitpod tutorial! ## New resources 📚 In order to help you during your animations but also to allow you to question your own results, guide sheets are online! **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/compare/1.5.0...1.6.0
name: Gébroulaz

More personalized end screen (simulation not started, not finished, low climate score, etc.) > - Share your simulation with a set of emojis > - New "public services" rhetorical question ## New animated graphic during the simulation 📊 ![Recording 2022-06-22 at 18 51 50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/175094066-43f5bce9-4237-4512-804c-a3b05e1c52e8.gif) ## New end screen highlighting the climate goal 🎯 ![Recording 2022-06-28 at 12 50 44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176161585-056d15aa-254d-4a64-aa24-2fb2c991d73a.gif) ## New end screen to explore one's footprint by subcategory (car, plane, heating, etc) 🧱 ![Recording 2022-06-28 at 12 51 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176161770-02cfa4e3-78c8-416d-abd5-9451ca78b71e.gif) ## New end screen to introduce actions 🏁 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176161176-52159706-1edb-4e4f-952f-78e04d319032.png) ## More customized end screen (simulation not started, not finished, low climate score, etc.) 👤 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176161146-fd4e8d70-3be7-4ea1-9816-93761eecde0a.png) ## Share your simulation with a set of emojis 🐦️ ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176162250-7c96207f-4381-4e51-869d-48aa966f8fd3.png) ## New "public services" rhetorical question 🏛️ ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176162161-ed8feb5b-d074-4c36-bd98-b646a03f7385.png) ## Improvement of our presentation component For the tutorial, and the end screen, we are monitoring the rate of slides. We made the next button more obvious via an animation, and now display the slides as circles above the slides ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176162070-5558bb9f-cdb3-47f4-abdb-a1d39171efc3.png) Its performance on the end screen has also been improved, for small processors ## New educational sheets We've added comprehensive fact sheets to explore more thoroughly what you can do for your digital footprint, via telecommuting, for your personal savings, etc ➡️ https://nosgestesclimat.fr/actions/plus ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/176163299-c8010c49-e66b-42de-a3cc-0ea0848c8dfd.png) ## Other improvements We are starting to work on the indexing of the site on search engines, and are making incremental improvements to the calculation model
name: Gabiétous (Gavarnie)

body: ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/Wikiecrins.jpg/800px-Wikiecrins.jpg) We have completely revised the selection of digital material. It was done here. Specifically, instead of 6 questions in a row, the user fills in his digital heritage in a single screen**, the questions (age, characteristics) being asked afterwards for the material filled in. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-22 12-14-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/111981663-40e9de80-8b08-11eb-8d1e-61a6de47e51a.png) This is an important step towards a better consideration of the digital footprint, previously limited by the inflation of questions that would result. Not much else in this version, but the next one will be substantial 😉

body: gabiétous Glacier](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Jeu_de_lumiere_aux_deux_alpes_02.JPG/640px-Jeu_de_lumiere_aux_deux_alpes_02.JPG) > The glacier des deux alpes is closed early this year > In brief : > - New breakfasts & hot drinks > - New waste calculation model > - Suggestions for answers in the form of buttons > - Optimization of the site weight ## New breakfasts & hot drinks 🥐☕️ ![width="800" alt="question-boissons-chaudes"](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/180246298-6037be7a-cd19-4d7c-b1b4-d14e9a7456b8.png) The breakfast question has been improved with new suggestions. A question about hot drinks also makes an appearance! ## New waste calculation model 🚮 The trash footprint is evolving! A more accurate model updates the waste footprint with a more recent source. All discussions are in this thread. A mosaic of eco-gestures has also been added. ## Suggested responses in the form of buttons ✨ Suggestions are now more visible. Some mosaics also show suggestions, which did not exist before, like the meal selection! ![width="800" alt="suggestions-repas"](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/180241201-1fe64d79-03ee-43f8-a26b-34ac1b515ee8.gif) ## Optimization of the site weight ↘️ At the level of the weight of the loaded javascript, we go from 1,4mo to 1,1 that is -20%. The performance of the site has been improved in an eco-design approach. The only visible difference is the font. All the advances at this level are in this discussion.
name: Deux alpes

body: ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Glacier_de_la_Grande_Casse_le_13_août_2016.JPG/640px-Glacier_de_la_Grande_Casse_le_13_août_2016.JPG) > In short: we listen to each of your feedbacks, and the improvement continues 🔄 ## 👂 We are listening to you! We've sorted and responded to more than 300 feedbacks since the launch of Nos Gestes Climat, all on the 'issues' tab. This allows us to understand the problems of the calculator to prioritize its improvement. ## Some simulation improvements 🚴 Cyclosphere, hello! Cycling makes an appearance in the simulator, and in the "go to work other than by car" action, which replaces "go to work by public transit". Walking 🚶♀️ and other modes are not left out obviously 🛴. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-02-08 15-42-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107234732-4097f700-6a24-11eb-9f54-ff64cf66183f.png) We let you guess the impact that this quesiton has on the results ;) We have also improved the input guides (e.g. number of houses: is it with or without me?) 🤳 The phone question has been revised, now that all recent phones are larger than 5 inches, and to take into account the 'no smartphone' option. 🔥🌲 The heating in steres of wood question becomes more relevant: it's counted in steres, not kWh. We will continue to improve the other entries soon (wood in pellets, fuel oil). ## Other improvements New features (like this one you are reading) now appear directly on https://nosgestesclimat.fr/nouveautés, it is still more accessible than on github 🙂 🐛 Several quite important bugs have been solved thanks to your feedback (simulation end always at 11 tons, default value input -> no "next" button, etc.) ## Our roadmap Now that the "issues" onget is clearer, it was time to put our roadmap on the simulator / calculation model side, it's in the "Projects" section. Everything is indicative, but it allows you to know what our current topics are > As for the interface, it is rather here that you should go to follow the progress.
name: Grands Couloirs

body: [ ![E0EetUdXsAIBhK5 resized resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121914885-f8bb1080-cd32-11eb-898b-fa39bae7a331.jpeg)](https://mobile.twitter.com/EtienneBerthie2/status/1387426262306656265) > Summary > We have redesigned the question on household appliances, asking for a list of appliances rather than an annual expense, and made the calculations more reliable > we have launched on the home page the function `conference` > > This release note borrows the name of the research work that analyzed the evolution of more than 200 000 terrestrial glaciers by analyzing satellite images. More info here ## Footprint of the appliances We move from a monetary factor to a list of possessions. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-06-14 17-09-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915179-446dba00-cd33-11eb-8406-1eb0828a0e7d.png) So we were probably overestimating the default footprint of appliances by a lot, as noted here Conversely, in this new version, the user is prevented from forgetting recent purchases, as he is offered a list not complete, but already quite full We were overestimating the footprint of household appliances as well because it was attributed entirely to the individual. We now divide it by the number of inhabitants of the dwelling ## Launching the conference mode in the foreground The feature is now open to everyone, on the home page It allows friends, colleagues and workgroups to interactively calculate their footprint together. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-06-14 17-10-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915284-5ea79800-cd33-11eb-8530-fe334eef9cd7.png) A new guide allows you to understand the principle before getting started. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-06-14 17-11-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915462-8434a180-cd33-11eb-850f-9b7fd909639b.png) Room names in French are automatically generated to avoid having to worry about finding a name. Other bugs in the /conference mode have been fixed.

body:
glacier de Tré-la-Tête](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Glacier_de_Tré-la-Tête.jpg/640px-Glacier_de_Tré-la-Tête.jpg) > This glacier of Tré-la-Tête is the 4th largest glacier in France. An interesting📽️ Brut video about it following the unusual summer of 2022 (29/07/2022) > **In brief** > - new logo, new iconography, new homepage > - a lot of small improvements to the site and the calculation model ## 🎨 A new logo, a new home page, and new icons You won't have missed it, Nos Gestes Climat is getting a new logo 🥳 ![](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/images/petit-logo.png) Frequently quoted in the press, it will go even less unnoticed
Here are some excerpts from the last two weeks alone ⬇️ Article from Ouest-France: In Carhaix, these energy specialists give their advice to consume less > It is also possible to calculate its carbon footprint on nosgestesclimat.fr Article from France Inter: A high-level runner explains why he is giving up the World Championships because of his carbon footprint > Andy Symonds has calculated, via the website "Nos Gestes Climat", that flying to Thailand would explode his carbon footprint. The Dauphiné Libéré launched a survey and quotes NGC > Find the results of our survey "The French and their carbon footprint > A French person emits on average 11.2 tons of CO2e per year. Experts estimate that this figure should be limited to 2 tons per year to slow down climate change and respect the objectives of the Paris Agreement. To know your carbon footprint, Ademe has launched an online tool "Nos Gestes Climat". Thus quoutside.fr.
The home page follows this graphic evolution with a few paragraphs to introduce the subject (and its limits) ### Before ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323489-088461c2-b1b9-46fe-bce2-c1e459104569.png) ### After ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323550-993c5109-ae91-4baa-8853-af240bf4c279.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323669-952493a1-7b17-4d38-a48b-313f2a592863.png) In the same way, we worked on the style and readability of the business icons throughout the site. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/192312016-67af3382-6e02-49db-b791-8ba1702eb0ce.png) ## 🐎 Performance (eco-design) We finished phase 2 of our sobriety work, in terms of site weight, with a significant gain. It's all relative, but a little sobriety on our side is the least we can do! ## 👆️ Other interface improvements - The survey mode is no longer in beta, it has already been used by hundreds of organizations - a notification appears when your home is depreciated (= built a long time ago): in this case, we don't ask you its surface notably (because we don't need it for the calculation), this surprised some users - the input of numbers in the questionnaire is now more constrained (you can't enter zero passengers in the car for example) to reduce the errors that can cause non-expected values (infinite or null values) - the button "I don't know" appears in the mosaics (https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/604) - the accessibility certificate (https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/621) is online, testifying to our work on this important aspect of Web sites Overall, a lot of work has been done on sorting and closing hundreds of return tickets, on the model side as well as on the site side, the contribution of the greatest number of people is still our priority. ## 🧮 Model side - update of the aircraft emission factors - the "consumption" part of the tea is already included in your electricity bill, it was a bug spotted thanks to our parallel work on monconvertisseurco2.fr - the emission factor of the French electricity mix for 2021 is updated ## 🌅 Coming soon... We are currently working on a regionalization (overseas) and internationalization of the site 😎. See you soon!

body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/96420391-bf5af100-11f5-11eb-9662-fbcbd1445ea0.png) > In short: introduction of the action sheets and a better model of the car ## Integration of the action sheets After the simulation, we now offer you a list of actions that significantly reduce your footprint ![Capture d’écran du 2021-01-25 11-23-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105693284-d2b9de80-5eff-11eb-8229-9c7dfd4f2a63.png) We have also integrated a detailed documentation for each of these actions ![Capture d’écran du 2021-01-25 11-26-37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105693599-347a4880-5f00-11eb-94c2-51a179b8bd48.png) ## Big improvement of the model: the construction of the vehicle 🚗 It is now amortized over several years. Previously, it was amortized over age, so an electric car bought 1 year ago would have its 12 tons attributed to that first year all at once, among other problems The depreciation method is explained here. It was also forgotten to divide the construction of the vehicle by the number of passengers, as was done for the use of the car. See #674 for all the thinking behind it. ## Other improvements ✨ It is clarified that we are asking for the energy consumption of the household, not the individual. This includes collocates who may each have their own amount in mind. We improved the texts of the questions on cars, and better documented the calculations.

body: ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/Aerial_view_of_Glacier_du_G%C3%A9ant.jpg/640px-Aerial_view_of_Glacier_du_G%C3%A9ant.jpg) ## English version 🇬🇧 Hi everyone! Nos Gestes Climat is now available in English 💂 ![Recording 2022-11-09 at 18 52 42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/200904084-6051257b-e0ce-4483-8d91-05b5bbd44e0b.gif) Of course, translation is a long-term task, so if you find a problem, we have a page dedicated to feedback ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/200904709-d6a19333-9c70-4033-bb15-bafde6661794.png) Soon, it will also be possible to calculate your climate footprint in Spanish, Italian and other languages > Beware, translation is not internationalization of the model: for the moment, there are only two calculation models, Metropolitan France and Guadeloupe. The others are coming soon! ## Brand new figures for the food footprint We have improved the footprints of lunch and dinner dishes First, we have improved the calculation of the emission factor of the most important component of the meals, meat and fish. Instead of a simple average, we now do a weighted average by national consumption (e.g. for the dish "meat 1", pork and chicken are no longer equally important) Secondly, there was a global update of agribalysis in October, which corrected overestimated emission factors. We have updated our figures with these More info. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/200906087-5748cab9-d053-48dd-b169-3038dcf50fa2.png) ## Navigation improvement during and after the test It is now easier to navigate through the categories and answers already given after the test ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/193876373-fd942951-afb3-40ec-8316-480b9bdf7241.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/193876420-5203196f-54af-42fb-b61b-9e2822da9a59.png) In the same way, a new button `Find my simulation` appears on the home page, and the test progress in % on the profile page. More info. ## A new page to explain our fossil dependency A new page to explain the stakes of reducing our oil and gas consumption. Indeed, climate is only one of them, and we are going through a period where inflation and geopolitical tensions are more and more integrated in the equation. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/200906228-cb2db1ba-3083-48eb-9a96-26f0fb02daf1.png)

body: ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f3/Merdeglace.jpg) ## Nos Gestes Climat, v1 > In summary > > The action screen has been completely redesigned with two paths and more gestures > The application has been partially redesigned: it is more modern and pleasant to use, especially on cell phones > we introduce *personas*, to better work on the next actions > share your simulation result on the networks, and people will see directly a capture of your assessment! ## Take action We have completely redesigned the /actions screen. We now have access to two modes, one guided where the actions are classified by our care, and the other autonomous which allows to tackle the biggest gestures of reduction. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 15-53-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846986-e5d75f00-90a6-11eb-8ca0-1be5736d5d9c.png) The selection of gestures is now more complete, there are now 17, in all categories. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 15-54-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112847173-161efd80-90a7-11eb-8f47-283dd1eb418a.png) ## Redesign of the application, especially on mobile - we adopt the conventions of modern mobile, with navigation buttons accessible with the finger at the bottom, and a session bar that gives the result of simulation also at the bottom and permanent ![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 11-05-15 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813673-c3c9e680-907e-11eb-94c9-b818073b7c45.png) - on the action screen, the session bar remains predictable, in the same place but with the color of the category ![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 11-07-12 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813831-f07dfe00-907e-11eb-9d4c-240dbaa7d74a.png) - we have gained vertical space on mobile. Why is this important? To make phones < 6 inches last. Not because 6 inches is bad, but because changing phones just for the screen is a shame. It won't revolutionize our footprint, but it's something! Before ! ![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 10-52-39 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813510-8ebd9400-907e-11eb-8db7-e2291ed24eaa.png) After ![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 10-52-51 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813516-8f562a80-907e-11eb-9ead-773133ff889c.png) ## Sharing simulation Big new feature that allows to preview the results of a simulation when sharing on social networks We hope to improve the distribution of the application. Below, a Whatsapp capture. ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112972961-1d9ae100-9151-11eb-9f34-bc3061ca35da.png) See <a href="https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/208">this PR</a>. ## Introducing personas This system, to be populated with profiles if possible representative of the population, will allow us to better test and develop the application. ![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 15-50-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846716-a14bc380-90a6-11eb-8060-219bed3d3ddf.png) ## Bug fixes We fixed a big bug: the "previous" button of the simulation was not working properly. We removed it, fixed the same problem that affected the "my answers" button, which now becomes the only way to change your answers. It has been widely promoted.

body: taconnaz Glacier](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c8/Taconnaz.JPG/576px-Taconnaz.JPG) > In brief > - redesign of the action path 🎯: slip actions into your cart to reduce your footprint > - the fish menu 🐟️ has finally arrived! > - a new permanent menu makes it easier to navigate > - you can now share your conference links with a QRcode ## A new path to action 🎯 Many users were complaining about the simplicity of our move-to-action path. We've redesigned it entirely, making it more like a mini-game where the goal is to reduce your footprint ![ngc-action-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139829768-5759d428-1e0d-4c7d-9fd3-682dbebb1b90.gif) This is just the beginning: we already have next steps planned to make engagement even easier. We are also introducing *personas*: typical profiles that you can select to experience the action path as a given citizen ## Menu 🐟️ We've received dozens of requests to include a fish menu on the diet choice screen. There are now 2 of them! ![Capture d’écran du 2021-11-02 11-29-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830102-bd7cee54-c1fd-454c-8eb0-7ce2a750ffa8.png) These new dishes have been made from the Agribalyse database, and the calculation is of course *open*. Many new food items will follow ## A new menu for the application Nosgestesclimat is designed to be used on mobile as on desktop. The mobile version now has a permanent menu at the bottom of the screen, and the desktop version of a new arrangement in two columns, with a menu also present on the left ![Capture d’écran du 2021-11-02 11-31-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830463-203c8896-0eda-49ad-ba45-be1a19e180de.png) This new menu makes the application more accessible, and it's just one of many accessibility improvements we have planned. ## The French average is now 9 tons! Unfortunately, this does not reflect unexpected efforts, but an improvement in the calculation method of the Ministry of the Environment The good news is that the French administration is taking the subject seriously, improving its calculations and explaining the differences in a scientific way Detailed explanations here. So why do we show an average of 9.8 tons in the simulator? Because our calculation is made using another method than the government one, complementary. More info here. ## Conference mode improvements 🏟️ This collective mode of using ourgestesclimate is more and more used. To facilitate the sharing of the link at the beginning of the conference, we generate a great QRCode that you just have to project or send by mail ![Capture d’écran du 2021-11-02 11-32-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830597-63fe1856-5622-4c52-b7f4-23ccbfaa6bd9.png) Another improvement, we exclude from the group results the simulations that resulted in a too high footprint, above 100 tons. This limit will be configurable soon ## Technical improvements 🐇 We continue to make the site lighter, removing a graphic animation library (react-spring) and better cutting out the conference mode from the rest of the application Of course, many reported bugs have also been fixed.

> In short: the nosgestesclimat.fr calculation engine has been completely modernized

In this version, not much changes for the users, and it is even the goal: to completely review the underlying code without introducing :bug: .

Nos Gestes Climat is now properly based on publi.codes. We have thus made up for the 8 months of improvements that the betagouv/my-company team made to this language, and removed the mountain of code that represented publicodes and that we were not actively developing here :+1 

![Capture d’écran du 2021-01-25 11-20-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105692891-4a3b3e00-5eff-11eb-93a3-91bfd9c78378.png)

We have thus taken one more step in the openness, readability and reproducibility of the calculation model we are developing here, and thus one more step towards a model for calculating individual climate footprints that would serve as a reference

body:
it is in the National Assembly in the 7th district of Paris that the State budget is voted each year](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/205978955-88a0ad61-244c-4afb-89a9-600eef3a5f1c.jpg) If you have ever done a carbon footprint test, you may have noticed a rather surprising category: public services. About 1 ton out of the French average of 10 tons, it may not seem like much... However, for those who adopt a rather low-carbon lifestyle, and more generally in relation to the objective of 2 tons of individual footprint (remember that the important thing is not the objective but the transition scenario), 1 ton can legitimately look like an elephant in the room! In this article, we tell you all about this famous "public services" or now "societal services" item in UCS: how it is calculated, what it is composed of, and how we just used these numbers to make a **✨ new version of the calculation model of nosgestesclimat.fr** ## The average French person emits 8.9 tons (November 2022) France, like many other countries, has set commitments to reduce its climate footprint To achieve this, we obviously need to know *where we are* today and how it evolves each year This is the task of the Ministry of Ecology's Data and Statistical Studies Department, which estimates it at 8.9 tons per person in 2021 How is this figure calculated? The explanation of the calculation is transparent but relatively difficult to understand, so we will simply explain the principle of this clever calculation Basically, to calculate a climate footprint, you have to start from a physical reality. We have to calculate the real greenhouse gas emissions (well, estimate it) of a concrete action: for example, we know that burning 1 liter of gasoline in a car emits about 2.7 kg of CO2. Then we can count the liters of diesel burned by French semi-trailers, by barges on rivers, by ships, planes, etc The problem then, is to calculate the footprint of other sectors, which do not directly burn these fossil fuels. For example, a hospital buys wooden furniture but does not manufacture or transport it itself. The furniture is cut up in a factory, which bought it. For this, a truck delivered wooden boards to them. This wood has been treated by the chemical industry, and produced by the forestry industry (the management of forest wood), which uses diesel chainsaws, etc The administration does not have a precise description of all these transactions (kg of wood, volume of oil and paint, etc.), but it does have the exchanges in € between all these sectors, at an aggregated level over the year, called macro. Thanks to these monetary exchanges, a matrix calculation allows to attribute to each sector the carbon footprint of its added value! These calculations are made periodically. The latest accurate version is for the year 2017, and the latest (less accurate) estimate is for 2021 ## Define the perimeter of a base attributed to each French company By summing up the footprint of all these sectors, divided by the population of the country, this gives the "macro" footprint per person In parallel, the calculation model of nosgestesclimat is a compilation of models called "micro": you are asked a multitude of questions to reconstitute *your carbon footprint* from physical data of consumption. > These are two perspectives on the same physical reality, two very different methods producing two figures, which fortunately converge around 9 tons of CO2e These two methods are very different, but they are also complementary: indeed, the analysis by consumption cannot capture all the emissions of a French person. If the micro method of nosgestesclimat allows to easily calculate the footprint of your car kilometers, it is unable to estimate the footprint of public services that you use in a diffuse way all year long, as well as commercial services such as the fiber and mobile internet network that most of the population benefits from in a latent way (admittedly in a variable way). We therefore need to adopt a hybrid model that mixes micro and macro. > The header photo of this article illustrates the problem: it is easy to estimate the climate footprint of the truck, the car and the motorcycle. But what about the footprint of this regularly re-bituminized road? What about the maintenance of the road signs? What about the footprint of the operation of the national assembly itself? The objective is then to define the perimeter of these complementary worlds in order to avoid double counting, and thus to obtain the final value of the constant societal services, the sum of public services and commercial services, attributed to each French person. ![Recording 2022-12-12 at 18 08 09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/207108876-1334c2b0-8275-43d5-a899-81d04c2230d9.gif) ## A first calculation We therefore analyzed the macro footprint data shared by the SDES, sector by sector, line by line, to include a share, from 0 to 100%, of the societal services footprint > It should be remembered that the objective is always to "obtain orders of magnitude": it is not a question of claiming a result to the nearest 10 kg of CO2. In this respect, it should be remembered that our climate objectives target a 90% reduction in our footprint The line "Public administration and defense" is obviously included in the public services: the citizen has no influence on these governmental positions other than through his vote and his public commitment Things get more complicated for example for the item "🏗️ construction": it includes many diverse activities benefiting the whole society, yet we do not have the details of their carbon footprint. An allocation is therefore made on the basis of the turnover of the sub-branches and sub-sub-branches published by INSEE, these are the % that you can see appearing in our documentation
Learn more about the breakdown by turnover of the SDES carbon data > The data provided by the SDES gives a carbon footprint corresponding to what is consumed on the French territory by economic branch (e.g.: E36 = water distribution network = 677 kTCO2e) or by group of economic branches (e.g.: F41_43 = Construction = 54116 kTCO2e) For this data, there is a first level of aggregation that we have chosen to disaggregate according to the share of turnover of the branch in the grouping proposed by the SDES (e.g.: for F41_43, we have F41=25%, F42=13.5%, F43=61.5%) > > Some of the data are secret, so we assumed that these data were also secret for the calculation of the national carbon footprint. In the absence of additional information, we have chosen not to consider them in these decomposition calculations. > > To go even further, we sometimes needed a higher level of precision by looking at the economic sub-branches. Indeed, if we take the example of E38 relating to waste collection, only sub-branches E3812 and E3822, concerning hazardous waste, were to be included in the utilities. We have therefore also used the breakdown by turnover to highlight the carbon intensity associated with the sub-branches in question within E38.
For market services, we have tried to include in the baseline footprint those consumptions that are relatively universal (e.g., everyone has to buy home insurance) or those that are not yet captured by our micro models (e.g., consumption of telecom services) but may be in the future If you are interested, you can explore our documentation that explains and justifies this allocation via the utilities and market services pages. It is quite "expert", we did our best for a first version, your feedback will be valuable. ## The result Here is a picture of our hybrid model ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/207576758-03cfbc96-a6a2-4817-a4cb-4c4562342783.png) ⚠️ Beware, do not see in this graph a reliable average value of the climate footprint of a French person, contrary to the SDES figure of 8.9t, but simply the anatomy of our hybrid calculation model. The values are likely to change regularly, in full transparency The objective of Nos Gestes Climat remains to estimate the footprint associated with the lifestyle of a real person. By the way, the objective of the next versions is precisely to cover many items that are currently left out 🐕️⛴️🛵⚡️🏡. See you soon!
name: L'empreinte climat des "services sociétaux"
